div.ab: Hear, O Freedom, the dispute of two servants: how they are convicted by each other, that they are powerless.
Response: To Thee be glory by Whose humiliation Adam was exalted: and by Whose death he was raised, and regained Eden!
If then the Evil One overcome thee, great is the shame: Death his comrade has convicted him, as being weak.
And if again Death subdue thee, lo! what reproach: for the Evil One his comrade derides him, as but a shadow.
Their dispute is for thee a mirror, wherein thou mayest see: that they both are but as chaff, before thy breath.
Yea and Prophets and Apostles, in their promises: assure thee that they like flowers, shall fade at the rising.
Satan: Thou, Death, art he whom they hate, the quick and dead: for every combination thou dissolvest, and destroyest.
Death: It is not open death that kills, O Satan: thy death which is secret kills the sons of men.
Satan: My name is not hateful as thine, for the angel: showed himself in Satan’s likeness to Balaam on the way.
Death: How fit is this thy name, O Satan: who hast erred and made unwary Adam err, from the way!
Satan: Wander not like one ignorant, and lose thy cause: dispute, O Death, if thou are competent, for replying.
Death: I know that thou art wily, O Satan: so that thou out of sand canst twist a snare.
Satan: Thy disputing, Death, is ended: for he who is worsted: when his words fail and are ended, begins to rail.
Death: Among all I am conqueror, and by thee am I worsted? Let Adam persuade thee whom I have overcome, O Satan!
Satan: I am he who bound Adam, and cast him before thee: the mighty man whom my wiles had bound, thou didst come and subdue.
Death: I am he who have been crowned anew, with a diadem in the world: for Adam, chief of the mighty, I hold captive in Sheol.
Satan: I killed him by secret death, even Adam when he sinned: thou, Death, hast slain one that was dead, killed by me.
Death: In thy desire to conquer, Evil One, thou hast made thyself hated: for thou art Death as well as Satan, and this seems a little thing to thee.
Satan: Thou hast then been silenced, Death, as a weakling: for neither in words nor in deeds, hast thou strength to stand.
Death: It is for thy evil thou conquerest, O Evil One, if thou discernest: thy crown is wholly of shame, if thou perceivest.
I shall be defeated and thou shalt be cursed, O Satan: it is well for me to be ignorant, and not mischievous.
Blessed be the Just One who divided them, though they were quite of one mind: Blessed be the Good One who made us of one mind, when we were divided.
I will overcome the Evil One through Thy forgiveness, O All-Merciful: and I shall overcome death through Thy Resurrection, O All-Life-giver!
